channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOJ says Boeing broke deal that avoided prosecution after 2 fatal 737 Max crashes
item.description: Boeing has violated the terms of a deal to avoid prosecution after the fatal crashes of two 737 Max planes more than five years ago, the Department of Justice told a federal judge on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
Boeing has violated the terms of a deal to avoid prosecution after the fatal crashes of two 737 Max planes more than five years ago, the Department of Justice told a federal judge on Tuesday.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: More Americans are falling behind on credit card bills
item.description: Credit card delinquencies rose in the first three months of the year. That's a sign of the growing financial stress that some families are feeling in an era of rising prices and high interest rates.
item.content:encoded:
Credit card delinquencies rose in the first three months of the year. That's a sign of the growing financial stress that some families are feeling in an era of rising prices and high interest rates.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Five things to know about Biden's tariff hikes on Chinese electric vehicles
item.description: The Biden administration is quadrupling tariffs on China-made EVs. The tariffs are part of a broad swath of protectionist policies first imposed by former President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The Biden administration is quadrupling tariffs on China-made EVs. The tariffs are part of a broad swath of protectionist policies first imposed by former President Trump.

(Image credit: STR)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: The Deadly, Hidden Threat to Gaza's Civilians
item.description: Unexploded bombs and other ordinance are hidden throughout Gaza posing a threat to civilians now and they will continue to potentially kill long after the war is over. We hear about a victim of one of these munitions and of the challenges of removing such threats as civilians are fleeing fighting.
item.content:encoded: Unexploded bombs and other ordinance are hidden throughout Gaza posing a threat to civilians now and they will continue to potentially kill long after the war is over. We hear about a victim of one of these munitions and of the challenges of removing such threats as civilians are fleeing fighting.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Small but mighty Nimble becomes first mixed-breed dog to win Westminster agility title
item.description: The border collie-papillon mix got a round of "app-paws" for her surprise win after finishing the race in under 30 seconds. She is the first mixed-breed and first 12-inch dog to win the competition.
item.content:encoded: The border collie-papillon mix got a round of "app-paws" for her surprise win after finishing the race in under 30 seconds. She is the first mixed-breed and first 12-inch dog to win the competition.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: The ship that struck the Key Bridge had electrical problems in port, the NTSB says
item.description: The huge container ship that struck the Key Bridge had electrical problems the day before it left the Port of Baltimore, according to a preliminary report released Tuesday by federal investigators.
item.content:encoded:
The huge container ship that struck the Key Bridge had electrical problems the day before it left the Port of Baltimore, according to a preliminary report released Tuesday by federal investigators.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: What to watch for as the WNBA season opens and interest spikes in women's basketball
item.description: Caitlin Clark has sold out arenas nationwide. But can she, alongside 2023's Rookie of the Year Aliyah Boston, turn around the league's worst team? Or will the Las Vegas Aces pull off a three-peat?
item.content:encoded:
Caitlin Clark has sold out arenas nationwide. But can she, alongside 2023's Rookie of the Year Aliyah Boston, turn around the league's worst team? Or will the Las Vegas Aces pull off a three-peat?

(Image credit: Gregory Shamus)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Driver of truck that hit farmworker bus in Florida, killing 8, arrested on DUI charges
item.description: The Florida Highway Patrol has arrested the driver of a pickup truck that crashed into a farmworker bus early Tuesday on charges of driving under the influence-manslaughter. At least 40 were injured.
item.content:encoded: The Florida Highway Patrol has arrested the driver of a pickup truck that crashed into a farmworker bus early Tuesday on charges of driving under the influence-manslaughter. At least 40 were injured.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump gets by with a little help from his friends during New York hush money trial
item.description: The courtroom has continued to be one of the main arenas for Trump's 2024 campaign, welcoming his allies from across the country in for a day of testimony.
item.content:encoded: The courtroom has continued to be one of the main arenas for Trump's 2024 campaign, welcoming his allies from across the country in for a day of testimony.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Alice Munro, Nobel Prize-winning short story author, dies at 92
item.description: The Canadian writer was known for her masterfully crafted short stories. Throughout her long career, she earned a number of prestigious awards including the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2013.
item.content:encoded:
The Canadian writer was known for her masterfully crafted short stories. Throughout her long career, she earned a number of prestigious awards including the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2013.

(Image credit: Peter Muhly)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong
